{{short description|Turkish serial killer|bot=PearBOT 5}} {{Infobox criminal | name = Seyit Ahmet Demirci | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | alias = "Mobilyacı katili" ("The Furniture dealers' Killer" | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Fatsa]], [[Samsun Province]], Turkey | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | residence = | nationality = Turkey | other_names = | occupation = | known_for = | height = | weight = | religion = | criminal_charge = Murder | penalty = | conviction_status = | allegiance = <!-- [[Lucchese crime family]] --> | motive = | conviction = | reward_amount = | capture_status = Arrested | wanted_by = | partners = | wanted_since = | time_at_large = | escaped = | escape_end = | comments = | victims = 3 | date = | time = | beginyear = 1998 | endyear = 1998 | country = | states = | locations = | targets = | fatalities = | injuries = | weapons = | apprehended = | imprisoned = | footnotes = }} '''Seyit Ahmet Demirci''' is a [[Turkey|Turkish]] [[serial killer]], who is dubbed "Mobilyacı katili" ("the Furniture dealers' Killer") in the media. He was convicted of killing three different furniture dealers.
Seyit Ahmet Demirci grew up in [[Fatsa]], [[Samsun Province]], northern Turkey.<ref name="h1"/><ref name="h2"/>
As a child he worked in a furniture shop. He claimed that at his age of 11 the elderly shop owner had sexually abused him in the basement of the shop.<ref name="h1"/><ref name="h2"/><ref name="cnnt1"/> He also claimed to have witnessed the molestation of a co-worker by the same employer in the shop basement.<ref name="h1"/>
He moved to [[Istanbul]] and developed hatred towards furniture dealers, particularly to those who said they have some other furniture in the basement. He committed his first murder shooting Ali Osman Beldek in the neck at the Turgut Reis neighborhood of [[Esenler|Esenler, Istanbul]] on 5 May 1998. Then, he shot Mehmet Kayatuzu dead in [[Bağcılar|Bağcılar, Istanbul]] on 4 June 1998, and two days later killed Celal Pınargöz also in Esenler.<ref name="h1"/> All three victims were selected randomly and unknown to him. His modus operandi was to shoot them with a single bullet in the neck in their shop's basement.<ref name="h1"/><ref name="h2"/> He was dubbed by the media as "Mobilyacı katili" ("the Furniture dealers' Killer").<ref name="h1"/><ref name="cnnt1"/>
He was arrested and prosecuted for serial murder. The judge focused on the possibility that mental illness was the cause of his criminality, despite the fact that three forensic medicine institutions attested that he has sound mind. The court wanted to sentence him with leniency,<ref name="h1"/> however, he was sentenced to the death penalty in three counts.<ref name="cnnt1"/>
Demirci stated that, had he not been caught, he would have continued until he had killed eleven victims. The significance of the number eleven for him was that was his age at the time of the alleged molestation.<ref name="h2"/>
